description: A collection of circles in a long tilted rectangular formation; there are two small square formations atop one another to the left of the rectangular formation, with the top formation slightly larger than the bottom. Each circle has a different number in the center denoting how many lines stem from that point. There is a dark red triangle toward the bottom of the rectangular formation, a pale yellow triangle at the top of the larger square formation, and a red triangle in the middle of the smaller square formation.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
